attributes.action: Debate the EU's Five Presidents’ Report & its likely impact on the UK.
attributes.background:
The report proposes the completion of Europe’s Economic, Monetary & Political Union.  It uses the terms 'euro area' and 'EU' in relation to its propositions; thus a likely impact on non-euro sovereign states such as the UK.
My concern is that our MPs are not fully aware of its content or impact.
attributes.additional_details:
The report can be accessed at: https://ec.europa.eu/priorities/publications/five-presidents-report-completing-europes-economic-and-monetary-union_en.
It states, 'And finally, towards a Political Union that provides the foundation - - - '. 
It uses doublespeak such as, 'The euro is a successful and stable currency', not withstanding the intractable problems a common currency has given countries such as Greece.

attributes.action: Hillsborough families compensated in full for 27 years of legal fees.
attributes.background: The Hillsborough victims families have for 27 years had to pay their own legal fees unearthing the truth of what happened on 15/04/89. The South Yorkshire Police and others held responsible for the tragedy that day have had their legal fees paid by the tax payer. Another miscarriage of justice.
attributes.additional_details: The families of the 96 people who died at Hillsborough have had to endure 27 years of pain and heartache uncovering what they always knew was the truth. The families themselves and campaign groups have had to find exorbitant amounts of money to fund a fight that should never have had to be fought whilst the establishment have continued to fund their cover up and lies fully funded by the tax payer.

attributes.action: Increase the resources allocated to child protection.  No more Ayeeshia's!
attributes.background: The case of Ayeeshia Smith is far from isolated. 1 child PER WEEK is murdered by their parent(s) in the UK. That simply has to stop. I'm calling on the Government to substantially increase the resources allocated to child social care and child protection, to try to make sure it never happens again
attributes.additional_details:
Ayeeshia Smith.  Baby Peter.
High profile names, for all the wrong reasons
But apparently, in the UK, one child per week is murdered by his or her parents.  Think about that: ONE CHILD PER WEEK KILLED BY THEIR PARENT(s).  Source:http://straightstatistics.fullfact.org/article/how-many-children-are-murdered-britain-every-year
In a supposedly civilised society, this simply cannot go on.  The government need to do whatever it takes - spend whatever is required - to make sure this never happens again

attributes.action: Government must provide Framework Documents on governance after EU Referendum
attributes.background: The Government provided the People of the UK with a referendum on whether they wish to stay in or leave the EU. The Government must therefore provide two framework documents that give clear guidance on how the UK would be governed under each option so that the People can reach a considered decision
attributes.additional_details:
Background information on why the Government should provide these two framework documents and the consequences if they do not, can be reviewed by the following link

https://www.dropbox.com/s/6nprf1f6wrth3bx/The%20forthcoming%20EU%20Referendum_Revision%201_Final%20Draft.pdf?dl=0

attributes.action: Crash for cash drivers to be banned from driving for life
attributes.background: Cash for crash scams are costing British drivers £400m a year in increased insurance premiums and putting everyone at risk of serious injury or death
attributes.additional_details:
Crash for cash costs British insurers £400m a year, that's £400m that you will have to pay through your increased insurance premiums.
It's only a matter of time before someone is seriously injured or killed by these maniacs. 
If they are British citizens then ban them for driving for life, if they are non-UK nationals then deport them and ban them from ever entering the UK.

attributes.action: The UK to join the Eurozone
attributes.background: Without integration into the Eurozone the UK will always remain a fringe state of the European union, both economically and politically, with this integration tourism and trade between the other Eurozone countries will become more efficient and build stronger political ties with other major nations.

attributes.action: Force all motorcycle delivery riders to pass a full UK motorcycle driving test
attributes.background: Most delivery motorcycle riders are riding on L Plates. i.e. they have not passed a full motorcycle driving test. Their standard of riding is poor and they pose a high risk to other road users/pedestrians. They are using the roads for commercial purposes, they should be forced to pass a driving test

attributes.action: British Army, Royal Navy and RAF shouldn't ban entry for people with autism,
attributes.background: Autism, Aspergers ect.. shouldn't be an automatic ban on entry to the forces this is something that should be assessed on a case by case basis. All the forces have their own doctors who can carry out these tests. Some not all people with autism would work fine within the forces revise the policy!!!!

attributes.action: All police forces and MPs have drug tests every 3 months
attributes.background: Both parties hold high responsibility jobs, If the public can be penalised for it, then so can police forces and MPs, what's good for the goose is good for the gander

attributes.action: It's time to make the UK Lottery have minimum pay-outs
attributes.background: There should be minimum pay-outs for 4, 5, and 5 plus the bonus ball. It should come out of their exorbitant profits, they have already moved the goalposts by increasing the price and numbers on the draw , time to be fairer, or time for a total boycott

attributes.action: Make all public houses in Nottinghamshire wheelchair accessible.
attributes.background:
I believe all public places should be accessible for all of our people. Places such as shopping centers, pubs, clubs, etc. 
All residents should feel invited and not excluded.

attributes.action: Build new and expand, grammar schools in England to provide quality education.
attributes.background: Recently Warwickshire council eleven plus exam was held. There were a couple of thousands of pupils who sat for the exam. But there are only about 300 to 400 places in the grammar schools in Warwickshire.  Please allow more and do not ban outright on the grounds of social mobility.
attributes.additional_details: The parents who want their child to study in grammar schools need to go through lot of struggles now.  House prices in grammar school catchment area is very high. As the population grows, demand for grammar schools among low and middle class families increased many folds. Allowing more grammar schools would only provide more choices to the parents and help social mobility. A blanket ban would cause more pressure to many hard working parents who wants to provide quality education.

attributes.action: Review the Council Tax system so that it reflects individual contributions
attributes.background: I believe that the current Council Tax system is outdated and unfair - taxing households rather than individuals - Why should single households pay almost as much as a 5 occupancy household, why should a property worth millions pay same as a council flat?
attributes.additional_details:
Tax should be paid on individual bases and proportional to each person burden to the local authority - Should 2 pensionnaires household pay same council tax as a family of 5? Should a single working professional pay towards services it does not currently use?
Also with property valuation completely changed from 25 years ago - should household taxation still be considered an option? 
On top of that local councils have constantly risen tax/year and discrepancies between boroughs are huge.

attributes.action: Make compulsory DNA testing in order to reduce crime a law
attributes.background: dna helps the police find criminals faster and more efficiently. in order to do this they need to take one mouth swab sample of everyone in the country. This may have negative effects on example would be privacy. But would you give a sample of your dna to keep you and your friends and family safe.

attributes.action: Sellers should complete building survey before the property goes on the market
attributes.background: When selling a property the building survey should be completed by the seller before it can go on the market, so that all parties involved are aware of any serious defects.This would expediate the process for buyers, who often only discover the property's faults late in the process, but also sellers
attributes.additional_details: Although the current rules are supposed to offer protection, as Sellers are meant to inform Buyers of serious defects if a previous sale has fallen through etc this is often not enforced. Instead late in the process, after the Buyer has already paid for a host of surveys, the true cost of the property becomes apparent. Having the survey completed first would make everyone aware of all issues at the start of the process, making life easier for all involved.

attributes.action: liquid vapours for e cigs to be hidden behind shutters like cigarettes
attributes.background: Im a non smoking mum who knows many young children getting hooked on e cigs & vapour pens, which no doubt will continue onto cigarettes. Liquid vapour needs to be behind shutters like cigarettes. Currently being advertised like sweets in a sweetie shop. Needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently caught my 11 yr old son  a vapour pen! I discovered that most of the yr 6 in primary school were smoking. Advertising is aimed at kids lemon soufflé, trifle, bubble gum & Coca Cola flavours. Once hooked they will Start smoking cigarettes to increase the tobacco industry sales. 
Today most people are trying to quit smoking so hence tobacco sales declining. The tobacco industry are now hoping to encourage younger generation. These liquid vapours need to be behind closed doors.

attributes.action: Government inquiry in to the award of the 2016 East Anglian Rail Franchise.
attributes.background:
Despite abysmal performance and failing the customer for many years, Abellio have been rewarded the East Anglian franchise.

We call for a full pubic review into this decision and a reassessment of the competitive bids.

attributes.action: Remove NHS surcharge on immigrants who are paying income tax and NI every month
attributes.background: Immigrants who pay income tax and NI every month have already made their contribution to NHS and they should have the right like any other working British citizens to use NHS without being double charged.
attributes.additional_details:
From 6 April 2015, immigrants from outside the European Economic Area (EEA) who are coming to the UK for longer than six months will be required to pay a ‘health surcharge’ when they make their immigration application. 
It is acceptable to make immigrants who do not work or pay income tax and NI to pay NHS surcharge to avoid extra burden on NHS funding; But it is unreasonable and discriminatory to make immigrants who pay income tax and NI to 'double contribute' in NHS.

attributes.action: Prevent NHS basing eating disorder treatment on low BMI, by providing more funds
attributes.background:
Currently, when people approach GP's due to eating disorders, many are turned away due to not having a low enough BMI.
With increased NHS funding, people can be given access to the treatment they need before it's too late; radically reducing the number of lives lost due to these deadly illnesses.
attributes.additional_details:
B-eat, the leading eating disorder charity estimated that in 2015, 725,000 people in the UK were affected by eating disorders; with Anorexia nervosa having the highest mortality rate of all mental disorders. 

According to the NHS, 1 day, for 1 patient in hospital costs around £400. Therefore, money would be saved by giving people the access to treatment they need, before they reach the point of needing a hospital admission; which can last months.

attributes.action: Make the swegway/hoverboard no longer governed by the highways act of 1835.
attributes.background: The highways act of 1835 was clearly not written with the swegway in mind. They are smaller than a baby's pram and a disability scooter and people are allowed to use them in public, so it is unjust for the swegway to be singled out and banned in public places.
attributes.additional_details: At the very least they should be legal in public parks as bikes, being much faster than a swegway, are allowed to be in parks but swegways are not.

attributes.action: Allow Armed forces personal to carry side arms for protection against abduction.
attributes.background: Due to the fact there gave been person's attempting abductions against our service personnel it is time to allow them to carry loaded side arms for protection against abduction.
attributes.additional_details: RAF Marham. Aldershot

attributes.action: To enforce that the CMS deal with both maintenance & contact thorough mediation
attributes.background: For the CMS to enforce that mediation must be attended by both parents in exchange for their  services. Both contact and maintenance are discussed and put to the courts. Solicitors and mediatiors can attend. Saving so much trouble and heart ache.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last two years I have gone through great troubles to arrange contact with my son Lucas. Since going through this I have noticed that there are several people going through the same... Alienation, unfair judgement in court, expensive solicitors. The CMS has sonics  legal power to peruse the money but don't do the same for contact. Making it easier to seperate a non living parent from their child with no obligation to maintain a healthy relationship between them. This must be stopped .

attributes.action: Make the government take a more active role in providing food for those in need.
attributes.background: We are campaigning on behalf of over 1.1 million people in the UK who have needed emergency food supplies from The Trussell Trust in the last year (1). Food bank usage is on the rise, but we believe it is the government's responsibility to provide food for their people, not that of the food banks.
attributes.additional_details:
The emergency food supplied by The Trussell Trust is estimated as less than half the number of the total amount of emergency food supplies distributed in the UK (2). However the government plan to cut welfare by £3bn by 2020 (2).

References:
1. https://www.trusselltrust.org/news-and-blog/latest-stats/#fy-2015-2016
2. http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/food-bank-usage-at-record-high-reveals-trussell-trust-a6984921.html

attributes.action: Those with IBD to be allowed parking spaces outside their home
attributes.background: There are an estimated 300,000 people living with IBD in the UK, and not all of these people can register as disabled. This means that those who don't have a driveway or a designated parking space outside their home can struggle to park and get inside quickly when suffering a flare up.
attributes.additional_details:
A painted bay, or a designated parking space outside a sufferer's home would make a great difference.
It's not just IBD, there are thousands of people within the UK that suffer from chronic illness that would benefit from a parking space outside their home.
Local councils will not help as some sufferers cannot register as disabled, and therefore are not legally obliged to help and in may cases won't.
We're not asking to park in disabled bays, just the ability to park outside our own homes.

attributes.action: stop the WPD from making radical changes to existing final salary schemes
attributes.background: All existing final salary schemes were signed  by the individual and the company after full explanation of the contents and should be legally binding .They should not be able to be manipulated by Ministers or the Work and Pensions department years later .

attributes.action: Review on Police Cautions
attributes.background: Police Cautions are to be used as an alternative to prosecution in minor cases. However they are so frequently used that people who accept them are unaware of the future implications of having a caution. Regulations & review on the dispensation of a police caution and length on a record is required.
attributes.additional_details:
It has become increasingly apparent the implications of a police caution and unfortunately it is not realised until it is too late. The bodies able to dispense a caution, police and CPS, often work together and it is a biased system in that those who investigate also give the reprimand.
The following links shed some light on this matter.
http://www.govyou.co.uk/remove-cautions-from-crb/
https://iaingould.co.uk/2013/06/03/a-caution-is-for-life-not-just-for-christmas/

attributes.action: Investigate the Use of an Oral TB Vaccine for Badgers.
attributes.background: The US are saving an endangered species of ferret from Sylvatic plague using an oral vaccine deployed in food. Can we adapt these ideas and find an oral TB vaccine for badgers with a food we can deploy near setts for them to eat?
attributes.additional_details:
I Googled oral TB vaccine and found there is one for humans and it's more effective than the jab.Oral TB Vaccine: 

http://www.australasianscience.com.au/article/issue-december-2012/oral-tb-vaccine-better-needle.html

The main objection to vaccination has always been the difficulty in trapping and injection. This solves that problem.

Ferret Vaccination Details: http://www.theverge.com/2016/7/12/12161792/ferret-candy-vaccine-drones-montana

attributes.action: Harsher penalties for racially abusing foreigners, blacks, Muslims and Asians.
attributes.background: Having seen people being racist and xenophobic towards foreigners, blacks, Muslims and Asians on the TV and in newspapers, it has angered me and I have had enough of it. I would like to see harsher penalties introduced to help reduce hate crime in the UK.

attributes.action: Issue a Travel Warning for the USA due to high gun crime and police brutality
attributes.background: Travel Warnings remain in place until situations change; some have been in effect for years. The ongoing police brutality and high gun crime in the USA is a potential threat to any tourist. Citizens should be advised of this danger and encouraged to avoid the USA until there are gun/police reforms.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all non-vehicular road users to wear hi-viz
attributes.background: In daylight or dusk, hi-viz is highly visible to road users.  To reduce the number of accidents on the road, we call for the Government to make it a legal requirement for all road users to wear hi-viz clothing including, but not limited to, motorcyclists, cyclists, runners, walkers and horse-riders.

attributes.action: Debate the UN report on human rights abuses and austerity
attributes.background:
The UN has produced a report which states the UK’s austerity policies are in breach of international human rights obligations.
The UN are “seriously concerned” by the state of inequality in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
UN report: E/C.12/GBR/CO/6
Download here:
http://tbinternet.ohchr.org/_layouts/treatybodyexternal/SessionDetails1.aspx?SessionID=1059&Lang=en

attributes.action: Move Cannabis to Class C and move it from a schedule 1 drug
attributes.background: Both of the current class and scheduling of cannabis are out of date, unscientific, completely against all evidence, have created enormous harm to society and has held back medical advances for over 45 years.
attributes.additional_details: The reclassification of cannabis from Class C to Class B was done as part of a deal made by Gordon Brown and the Daily Mail editor. This was done against the findings, research and recommendation of the ACMD. The schedule 1 status means that the drug has no medical value. This is completely wrong as it was still being prescribed as a medicine in the UK until 1971. Over the last 20 years there have been on average 2 published studies per day on medical cannabis. People are suffering as a result.

attributes.action: Parliament should set up an Office for Electoral Information Integrity.
attributes.background: In the modern age it is possible for all well intentioned MP's to sometimes present incorrect information or correct information in a misleading way. This erodes public confidence both in MPs as well as in the whole political system, which ultimately undermines democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
The OEII would have the following functions:
1) define and publish standards for information impartiality and comprehensibility
2) provide advice to MPs on how best to present information in an impartial and generally comprehensible way
3) during the purdah period in the run up to elections or referenda, it would scrutinise information placed in the public domain by political parties or groups and would issue public statements describing how the presented information is deficient when needed.

attributes.action: To implement a Civil Law consequence to racist and xenophobic behaviour.
attributes.background: We need to promote tolerance and equality now more than ever. This proposal is IN ADDITION to The Equality Act 2010. A number of racist and xenophobic offences do not reach a conviction in court due to a lack of evidence. We propose that some incidences could be settled under Civil Law.
attributes.additional_details: Proposal: Party A is victim to racist or xenophobic behaviour by Party B. Party C is witness to the event and gives a statement. A document states Party A will not press charges if Party B agrees to pay a significant fine OR attends a Humanity awareness course which will aim to educate and promote tolerance and understanding. The course completion will be subject to the course provider certifying that party B demonstrated remorse and engaged with the subject matter.

attributes.action: Make BBC Parliament exempt from the TV licencing requirements
attributes.background: It is ridiculous at best, and undemocratic at worst, that in order to watch our elected representatives at work we're required to pay the BBC a licence fee. Whilst the argument is understandable for other BBC services, we should not have to pay to watch the democratic process of our country at work.

attributes.action: Use government resources to co-ordinate a modern Buy British campaign.
attributes.background: We can make and grow world-class produce and services in the UK.  Buying British is the most effective way to avoid recession now and spur long-term GDP growth regardless of EU membership.

attributes.action: Put Food Technology back on the A and AS level options.
attributes.background: My friend wants to become a chef when she graduates university, however without an A level course in Food Technology she feels as though other older candidates, who had the option of this course, will be better prepared for the job, therefore more likely to be hired.

attributes.action: Only allow people who have served in the British Armed forces to vote.
attributes.background: Someone who has served their country and have been prepared to lay down their life should be allowed to vote. Therefore it should be a requirement that a person serves a minimum of 3 years in the armed forces to be eligible to vote in an election or referendum.

attributes.action: Make feeding owned cats a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Sign this petition to help get the law changed on feeding owned cats. 
Feeding someone else's cat can cause them to leave home, causing stress and upset to the beloved cats owners/family. 
At present the police/rspca/cats protection will not help, as there is no law on feeding another persons cat.

attributes.action: Petition for a referendum to decide on a 2nd British referendum on EU membership
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a referendum to decide on whether another EU referendum will take place. If the yes vote is more than 60%, then a second EU referendum, also with a 60% majority threshold requirement for the winning side, should be held.

attributes.action: A referendum should not be retaken for the same issue for at least 10years
attributes.background:
Following the recent vote leave result, a law should be passed preventing the Re-Polling of the same subject for a minimum period of time. I suggest this should be 10 years. 
Once the general public have had their democratic say, this should not be undermined by a second referendum.

attributes.action: A second referendum should be carried out in the event that the EU reforms.
attributes.background: Due to fears of other countries exiting the EU, a reformation may take place within the union. If this does occur, then the UK should have another opportunity to decide whether it wishes to remain in a reformed EU or not, prior to the triggering of Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland may well be having another referendum for their independence due to the changed circumstances between the UK and the EU. Similarly, should EU reformation occur, the circumstances will  have changed. Therefore, the UK should be given the opportunity to have a new referendum on its membership in the EU.

This should be carried out prior to the triggering of Article 50 to ensure that our position and influence in the EU is maintained.

attributes.action: Make a second EU referendum not up for debate for four years.
attributes.background:
The humans of the United Kingdom won a Democratic Vote to LEAVE the European Union. 

Please ensure by a legally binding contract all referendums on the same political-economical topic have four year gaps. We cannot have a second European Union referendum this close to the first.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Respect for moralistic democracy 
2. Post-pone second referendum for 4 years
3. Over-rule petition for second European Union referendum that is desired for this year.

attributes.action: A referendum to decide whether Norwich should become an independent nation.
attributes.background: After the result of the European Referendum, particularly the result in Norwich, we believe that Norwich has the infrastructure to become an independent nation, separate from the UK. After years of neglect from Westminster, Norwich has a better chance of growth if we leave the UK.

attributes.action: Create new Special Economic Zone for London, NI & Scotland which remains in EU
attributes.background: Although a majority of the UK voted to leave the EU a large majority of those in London, NI and Scotland voted to remain. These areas will suffer the most from the UK leaving the EU. Special Economic Zones have been created in many countries, including China, with much success.
attributes.additional_details:
We know the EU isn't perfect and needs radical reform but for many in the UK that doesn't mean we should leave it. This petition requests that the creation of a Special Economic Zone is discussed in Parliament. This Zone would remain a member of the EU and contain London, and perhaps other interested contiguous regions.

This SEZ would enable these regions to continue trading from within the EU thereby fostering increased trade, investment and job creation.

attributes.action: Explore further concessions to remain within the EU
attributes.background: We propose that the government explore all possibilities of gaining further concessions from the EU in order that the UK might remain a member nation. The ramifications of leaving the EU will be devastating for the continent as a whole. All options need to be explored prior to closing the door.
attributes.additional_details:
It is evident that the UK's current relationship with the EU was rejected by a very slim margin and it is important that this rejection is respected. However due to the size of the margin and a previous offer of further concessions from it would be undemocratic not to explore all available options as long as there is sufficient support for this petition. 

We owe it to future generations to explore all options before we inflict such a profound socioeconomic change on the UK and the EU.

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in the Prime Minister & the Chancellor of the Exchequer.
attributes.background:
Many electorate find the PM's behaviour & that of the Chancellor in the EU Referendum run up well below the standards expected of holders of high office.

Speculation, "Project Fear" & blackmail threats of raising taxes if we vote leave fall below what ordinary people require of their leaders.

attributes.action: To make August Bank Holiday Monday reclassified as ‘England Day.’
attributes.background: Given the rich and illustrious history of England, I propose that this day be given a new name and purpose and call it 'England Day?’ By a stroke of good fortune, historical evidence suggests that this time of year coincides with the emergence of England as single sovereign state, 1091 years ago.
attributes.additional_details: Living in England is a great privilege and we should celebrate this. The transition from Bank Holiday Monday to England Day, couldn’t be simpler or more convenient, coming in late summer it would be part of the three-day holiday. This proposal is not competing with St George’s Day. This proposal seeks to promote a public holiday that already exists, by giving it status and relevance. If this idea appeals to you, please add your name to the petition.

attributes.action: Raise a vote on no confidence in the Chancellor
attributes.background:
In the run up to the EU Referendum the Chancellor has acted in an irresponsible manner.

This petition is to raise a vote on no confidence on behalf of the public whom he represents. His behaviour is irresponsible and is misleading the British public.

attributes.action: Hand the same £100 on the spot fine to cyclists without a helmet.
attributes.background: Motorists are given an on the spot fine for not wearing a seatbelt.  There is no reason this should not be imposed upon a cyclist on a cycle without head protection.
attributes.additional_details: There are already many changes in cyclists favour. Prioritised junctions, Left turn bans, Stricter lgv regulations, mirrors at junctions, but still day after day they dart around without safety equipment. More responsibility should be put on them.
